text: When I feel jealousy rising, I notice it and choose to understand what it's protecting instead of reacting.
During moments of comparison or insecurity, I pause and breathe before letting jealousy control my behavior.
When I notice jealousy thoughts, I recognize them and choose to question assumptions instead of believing them.
I let jealousy become toxic and controlling, damaging my relationships and my own peace.
When I feel the urge to check or control my partner due to jealousy, I notice it and choose to trust instead.
I see when jealousy is based on fear rather than reality, and I choose to separate them.
When I notice myself comparing or feeling threatened, I recognize it and choose to build self-worth instead.
I let intense jealousy feel out of control and drive me to act in ways I later regret.
When I feel jealousy about someone else's attention or connection, I notice it and choose to communicate calmly instead.
I recognize when jealousy comes from old wounds rather than the present situation, and I respond accordingly.
When I notice the pull to make accusations or test my partner, I recognize it and choose to trust instead.
I let jealousy prevent me from managing my emotions healthily and maintaining trust in relationships.
When I feel threatened by someone else's presence or connection, I notice it and choose to address my insecurity instead.
I see when jealousy is protecting something important, and I choose to address the underlying need directly.
When I notice jealousy thoughts spiraling, I interrupt them early by staying grounded and questioning the story.
I let jealousy control my behavior and prevent me from building healthy, secure relationships.
When I feel the urge to act on jealousy impulsively, I notice it and choose to wait and think clearly instead.
I recognize when jealousy is based on imagination rather than evidence, and I choose to focus on reality instead.
When I notice jealousy patterns repeating, I recognize them and choose to break the cycle with awareness.
I let jealousy become toxic and prevent me from managing it in healthy, constructive ways.
